metadata.Title: CVE-2010-3704 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The FoFiType1::parse function in fofi/FoFiType1.cc in the PDF parser inxpdf before 3.02pl5, poppler 0.8.7 and possibly other versions up to0.15.1, kdegraphics, and possibly other products allows context-dependentattackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly executearbitrary code via a PDF file with a crafted PostScript Type1 font thatcontains a negative array index, which bypasses input validation andtriggers memory corruption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3704` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

xpdf - 3.02-12ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
libpoppler58 - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
poppler-utils - 0.16.0-0ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xpdf package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.02-12ubuntu1').
poppler package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.16.0-0ubuntu2').
ipe package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
